snippet.title: The React Native Show Podcast Ep 1: "Look into the future of React Native Testing Library"
snippet.description:
Episode 1 - Look into the future of React Native Testing Library with Michał Pierzchała

In the first episode of our podcast, Mike "grabbou" Grabowski(the host) is talking about React Native Testing Library with his guest - Michał Pierzchała (@thymikee) who is the owner of the library.

During the conversation, they cover such topics as:

* Introduction to the React Native Testing Library
https://callstack.github.io/react-native-testing-library/
* What is it? What is the case for it? A bit of history?
* A quick glimpse at the “Testing Library” concept itself
* Why it has been created? What is this all about?
* “React Native Testing Library” is under Callstack and separate from the ecosystem – what is the story behind that?
* What kind of technical differences is between RNTL and the ecosystem? And why so many?
* The current state of the library
* What is the future of the React Native Testing Library?

Learn more about React Native testing from our blog:
1. React Native Testing Library 2.0 – What’s New?
https://callstack.com/blog/react-native-testing-library-2-0/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast

2. Merge of React Native Testing Libraries
https://callstack.com/blog/merge-of-react-native-testing-libraries/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast

3. React Native Testing Library with Redux
https://callstack.com/blog/react-native-testing-library-with-redux/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast

4. From Enzyme to React Native Testing Library: How I Changed My Way of Unit Testing
https://callstack.com/blog/unit-testing-from-enzyme-to-react-native-testing-library/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast

#TestingLibrary #ReactNative​ #ReactJS​ #JavaScript​ #softwaredevelopment​ #programming​ #Callstack​ #TheReactNativeShow

snippet.title: React Native Testing Library 2.0 - what's new?
snippet.description:
In this video Mike Grabowski (@grabbou) and Mike Pierzchała (@thymikee) talk about the latest release of version 2.0 of React Native Testing Library.
https://callstack.github.io/react-native-testing-library/

What is React Native Testing Library?
The React Native Testing Library, or RNTL in short, is a lightweight solution for testing your React Native components. It provides helpful utility functions on top of the official react-test-renderer letting you always be up to date with the latest React features. Its opinionated API aims to prevent developers from testing implementation details of their React components while focusing on user experience and accessibility.

Learn more about React Native testing from our blog:
1. React Native Testing Library 2.0 – What’s New?
https://callstack.com/blog/react-native-testing-library-2-0/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast_short

2. Merge of React Native Testing Libraries
https://callstack.com/blog/merge-of-react-native-testing-libraries/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast_short

3. React Native Testing Library with Redux
https://callstack.com/blog/react-native-testing-library-with-redux/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast_short

4. From Enzyme to React Native Testing Library: How I Changed My Way of Unit Testing
https://callstack.com/blog/unit-testing-from-enzyme-to-react-native-testing-library/?utm_campaign=RN_Testing&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=testing_podcast_short

#TestingLibrary #ReactNative​ #ReactJS​ #JavaScript​ #softwaredevelopment​ #programming​ #Callstack​ #TheReactNativeShow

snippet.title: The React Native Show Podcast Ep 2: "React Native EU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel"
snippet.description:
Episode 2: RNEU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel

00:00 Introduction
11:48 New Architecture
23:37 Multiplatform
44:40 General Development

In episode 2 of The React Native Show podcast Mike Grabowski host a Q&A panel answering questions from React Native EU 2020 conference.

The guests include:
- Monica Restrepo - Software Engineer at Major League Soccer
- Kudo Chien - Software Engineer at CloudMosa
- Eloy Duran - Principal Software Engineer at Microsoft
- Ram N - an Engineering Manager at Oculus

Some of the questions from the conversation:
- What is the status of the React Native re-architecture?
- What changes are already shipped and when do we expect to have an update on the rest of them?
- Where one can track updates on the re-architecture?
- Can we expect a smooth transition path between current and “new” React Native ?
- What was the biggest (and latest) performance challenge that you have faced at your job and how did you solve it? What were the takeaways from the solution?
- What is the feature that you’re most excited about that’s coming up?

Read more about React Native EU 2020 Virtual Conference:

1.React Native EU 2020 Virtual Edition – Summary
https://callstack.com/blog/react-native-eu-2020-virtual-edition-summary/?utm_campaign=React_Native_EU&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=rneu_q_%26_a_podcast

snippet.title: The React Native Show Podcast - Episode 3: "Dive Into React Native Paper UI Kit"
snippet.description:
Is UI kit good for your next mobile app? Well, React Native Paper definitely is!

This time, our host Mike Grabowski and his guest, Dawid Urbaniak, the lead engineer on React Native Paper, are talking about this popular UI library. 

Here is the agenda for this episode:
Introduction part:
- introduction to React Native Paper
- key features of React Native Paper 
- how is React Native Paper different from the other libraries such as Native Base or React Native Elements 

A dive into React Native Paper:
- How did the React Native Paper team approach animations to make them truly native-looking?
- What opportunities do you think Turbo Modules and Fabric will bring in terms of performance? Are they likely to make animations even smoother?
- What are the details of the major upgrade to the library that include support for Material Design 2.0?
- Designers often make their slight adjustments and create whole new components when working with Material Design. Is Paper an “all or nothing” UI library or can you easily adjust it and extend it to your own designs?
- Can designers use some parts of Paper to create their own UI library?
- What makes the React Native Paper so unique and popular?
- Plans for the future of React Native Paper. 

Sit back, relax and enjoy The React Native Show!

Don’t forget to push the Subscribe button and share this video on your social media. More episodes are coming soon!

Read more about React Native Paper:

1. How Can React Native Paper Help Startups and Enterprises?
https://callstack.com/blog/react-native-paper-for-startups-and-enterprises/?utm_campaign=RN_Paper&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=paper_podcast

snippet.title: React Native Paper Supports Material Design 2.0
snippet.description:
For React Native Paper to support Material Design 2.0, serious adjustments had to be made. We managed to migrate all React Native Paper components to comply with Material Design 2.0, which means that now you can build apps following its standards.

In this extract of The React Native Show, our expert, Dawid Urbaniak (@trensik), is sharing some details about the major changes that needed to be introduced as well as challenges that he faced in the process. 

Check more info about the full episode about React Native Paper:
https://callstack.com/blog/the-react-native-show-podcast-episode-3-react-native-paper-ui-kit/

Read more about React Native Paper:

snippet.title: New Architecture of React Native | React Native EU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel
snippet.description:
The React Native team announced a lot of changes to the core of React Native that address a lot of challenges that developers were facing when building apps. The changes include:

- Turbo Modules - the new implementation of native modules created for better performance and synchronous access,
- CodeGen - to ease the creation of native modules by synchronizing the typed definitions,
- JSI - JavaScript Interface,
- Fabric - UI re-architecture.

In this part of The React Native Show podcast, our host, Mike Grabowski, and his guests:

Monica Restrepo – Software Engineer at Major League Soccer
Kudo Chien – Software Engineer at CloudMosa
Eloy Duran – Principal Software Engineer at Microsoft
Ram N – an Engineering Manager at Oculus

discuss the details of the upcoming re-architecture of React Native.

In this video you’ll hear about:
- What is the status of the re-architecture? What changes are already shipped and when do we expect to have an update on the rest of them?
- Where can we track the updates on the re-architecture?
- Can we expect a smooth transition path between the current and, let’s say, the “new” React Native?
- One of the latest and greatest features that are currently running on Android in production is Hermes – a JS engine. What are the biggest differences from the V8 JavaScript engine and why was there a decision to essentially write something from the ground up?

This video is a part of The React Native Show Podcast Ep 2: "React Native EU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel" 
Watch the full episode here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OHSe66Dhs7M

Read more about React Native EU 2020 Virtual Conference:

1.React Native EU 2020 Virtual Edition – Summary
https://callstack.com/blog/react-native-eu-2020-virtual-edition-summary/?utm_campaign=React_Native_EU&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=rneu_q_%26_a_podcast_short

snippet.title: Multiplatform Aspect of React Native | React Native EU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel
snippet.description:
In this part of The React Native Show podcast dedicated to the multiplatform aspect of React Native, our host, Mike Grabowski, and his guests:

Monica Restrepo – Software Engineer at Major League Soccer
Kudo Chien – Software Engineer at CloudMosa
Eloy Duran – Principal Software Engineer at Microsoft
Ram N – an Engineering Manager at Oculus

are talking about the future of React Native and its general direction.

You’ll hear about:

- What opportunities do our guests envision when it comes to sharing code between mobile & web (traditional React and React Native targets) and desktop environments?
- What I really like about React Native is the separation of concerns and that there’s a clear concept of a renderer that one can use to take React to a whole new platform. Do you think it could – potentially – be an interesting achievement for the Flutter community that would make React Native a viable choice for them?
- How does Microsoft plan to implement the features from the re-architecture, such as CodeGen, when they land? Is this something you’re already thinking about?

This video is a part of The React Native Show Podcast Ep 2: "React Native EU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel" 
Watch the full episode here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OHSe66Dhs7M

Read more about React Native EU 2020 Virtual Conference:

snippet.title: React Native - Best Practices | React Native EU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel
snippet.description:
In this part of The react Native Show podcast dedicated to the general development of React Native, our host, Mike Grabowski, and his guests:

Monica Restrepo – Software Engineer at Major League Soccer
Kudo Chien – Software Engineer at CloudMosa
Eloy Duran – Principal Software Engineer at Microsoft
Ram N – an Engineering Manager at Oculus

are answering questions related to the best practices and challenges that developers are facing in their daily work.

Questions list:
- What was the biggest (and latest) performance challenge that you have faced at your job and how did you solve it? What were the takeaways from the solution?
- React Native is being widely used by companies that already have a native mobile application to share certain pieces of the UI across platforms or to eventually migrate to it, by replacing screen after screen on a production application. What kind of challenges do you see in that area these days and what would you advise someone who is looking into migrating a native application?
- What is your typical workflow when working on a new app? Do you rather build something your own using low-level primitives or you pull in community libraries, such as react-native-paper?

This video is a part of The React Native Show Podcast Ep 2: "React Native EU 2020 Conference Q&A Panel" 
Watch the full episode here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OHSe66Dhs7M

Read more about React Native EU 2020 Virtual Conference:

snippet.title: The React Native Show Podcast - Episode 4: "Expert Guide to React Navigation"
snippet.description:
In this episode of The React Native Show podcast our host, Mike Grabowski, and his guests:
Satya Sahoo and Mateusz Kosoń, software engineers at Callstack, are talking about the React Navigation library. 

During the conversation, they cover a wide range of topics related to the React Navigation library, including:

- What is React Navigation library and what’s its biggest selling point?
- What was the idea behind creating the React Navigation library? 
- How did it happen that React Navigation became a “recommended” library in the community?
- What’s coming up with the React Navigation v5?
- What issues does React Navigation v5 solve?
- What do our guests appreciate most about React Navigation v5?

Also, our guests gave us some sneak peaks at what’s coming up with the upcoming React Navigation v6.0!

Sit back, relax and enjoy The React Native Show!

Don’t forget to push the Subscribe button and share this video on your social media. More episodes are coming soon!

00:00 Introduction
1:50 Intro to React Navigation
12:43 Changes in React Navigation v5
18:30 Issues solved by React Navigation v5
27:17 Practicalities of React Navigation v5
34:34 React Navigation v6 sneak peak

snippet.title: Practicalities of React Navigation 5
snippet.description:
In this video Mike Grabowski (@grabbou), Satya Sahoo (@satya164), and Mateusz Kosoń (@_matkoson) are talking about the practicalities of React Navigation 5 and benefits of using the 5th version of the library. 
https://github.com/react-navigation

This video snippet is taken from The React Native Show Podcast. You can watch the whole episode here:
The React Native Show Podcast - Episode 4: "Expert Guide to React Navigation"
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S2uZe6AkZOM&list=PLZ3MwD-soTTHLUonsfIOUbmAl3B73EGXg&index=15

Learn more about react Navigation on our blog:

snippet.title: The React Native Show Podcast - Episode 5: "React Native 0.64 with Hermes for iOS"
snippet.description:
In this episode of The React Native Show podcast our host, Mike Grabowski, and his guests: 
- Eloy Durán, a Software Engineer at Microsoft (https://twitter.com/alloy)
- and Xuan Huang, a Software Engineer at Facebook (https://twitter.com/Huxpro)

It’s a great opportunity to know the details of this major update to React Native 0.64 because Mike, Eloy and Xuan worked together on bringing Hermes to iOS!

In the first part of the podcast, our experts focus on the following topics:
- Hermes improvements to React Native apps in terms of three metrics: Time To Interactive (TTI), Application Size (APK), Memory consumption
- The “magic” behind Hermes - “Bytecode Precompilation” a.k.a. AOT
- The difference between AOT and JIT
- JIT JS engine pipeline vs Hermes pipeline
- The Hermes roadmap and plans for further improvements

Later on, Mike and his guests talk about the story behind bringing Hermes to React Native MacOS and take a quick look into the future of this major update.

In this part, they cover the following topics:
- What was the motivation behind adding support for Hermes on MacOS? Any plans for RN Windows?
- Were there any attempts to bring Chakra to run on macOS, to say, provide more unified experience across desktop platforms?
- On Apple devices, unlike Android ones, there was always less of performance and memory related issues when it comes to running React Native applications. What would be the selling point of Hermes in such a case?

This and much more awaits you in the Episode #5 of The React Native Show!

Don’t forget to push the Subscribe button and share this video on your social media. More episodes are coming soon!

No time to watch the video? Listen our podcast on your favorite podcast platform:
SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/user-985069846/react-native-064-with-hermes-for-ios
Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/dk/podcast/react-native-show-podcast-episode-5-react-native-0/id1525543072?i=1000521422294
Google Podcasts: https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cHM6Ly9mZWVkcy5zb3VuZGNsb3VkLmNvbS91c2Vycy9zb3VuZGNsb3VkOnVzZXJzOjg1OTU2MzYxOS9zb3VuZHMucnNz/episode/dGFnOnNvdW5kY2xvdWQsMjAxMDp0cmFja3MvMTA0Njc0MzgwMQ?sa=X&ved=0CAUQkfYCahcKEwi4p9a268PwAhUAAAAAHQAAAAAQAQ
